contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in a positive way. Alternate translation: "a completely truthful man" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-litotes]])
This sentence states the opposite of what it means for emphasis. Alternate translation: "I will keep everyone who comes to me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-litotes]])
contextId.quote: τὸν ἐρχόμενον πρός ἐμὲ, οὐ μὴ ἐκβάλω ἔξω
contextId.glQuote: he who comes to me I will certainly not throw out

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here litotes is used to emphasize that Jesus will keep everyone that God gives to him. Alternate translation: "I should keep all of them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-litotes]])
contextId.quote: πᾶν ὃ δέδωκέν ... μὴ ἀπολέσω ἐξ αὐτοῦ
contextId.glQuote: I would lose not one of all those
